newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Palmer raises ANI stake to 8.442 pct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Palmer raises ANI stake to 8.442 pct.

text.p: A company associated with ousted Australian National Industries Ltd (ANI) director Ross Palmer said on Tuesday it had increased its stake in ANI to 8.442 percent from 5.172.
Tube Securities said in a stock exchange disclosure notice that number of shares it held in the engineering group had increased to 66.35 million from 40.65 million.
It did not say when the most recent purchases took place but there has been heavy trading in ANI shares in recent days.

On Monday, Palmer lost his battle to retain his seat and remove fellow directors after an acrimonious board split over ANI's investment in German environmental engineering group Holter. Palmer ally Fred Smith won re-election to the board.
ANI shares closed on Tuesday four cents higher at A$1.26 on turnover of 3.5 million shares.
